incidents.name: Voice Insights Call Summaries Delayed in US1

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing voice insights call summaries delays in US1 region. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in voice insights call summaries delays in US1 region. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Voice Insights call summaries for calls that ended after 1:40am UTC are being processed successfully and are available via Console, Rest APIs and Event Streams. Our engineers are working on backfilling the call summaries for calls that ended between Aug 25th 23:36 and Aug 26th 1:40am. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We've become aware of a potential issue with voice insights call summaries delayed. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: MMS Delivery Delays to AT&T US via a Subset of Long Code

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team detected a degradation on MMS delivery delays to AT&T US via a Subset of Long Code for 48 minutes between 06:22 and 07:10 Pacific Time on 2025-08-22. During this period of time customers may have experienced MMS delivery delay to AT&T US via a subset of Long Code. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failures to Syriatel in Syria

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have identified the root cause of the SMS delivery failures to Syriatel in Syria. The carrier has begun enforcing Sender ID registration. This means messages to Syriatel can only be delivered when sent from a registered alphanumeric Sender ID; no other Sender ID types are supported.

Please note that in July 2025, Twilio announced through direct customer communications that SMS delivery to Syria will no longer be supported starting September 15, 2025. Customers were advised to remove Syria traffic from Twilio and transition to alternative messaging providers.

From now until September 15, 2025, SMS delivery to Syriatel in Syria will be on a best-effort basis only. If messages fail, Twilio will not be able to provide troubleshooting support. After September 15, 2025, all messaging traffic to Syria will be blocked.

incidents.name: Programmable Messaging API partially Degraded

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded for 2 minutes between 07:39AM and 07:41 Pacific Time on 08/18/2025. During this period of time customers may have received elevated volumes of 5xx errors in API responses. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Programmable Messaging API. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.
